Violation_Type: Procedural errors in refugee status determination
Legal_Issue: Evaluation of evidence and application of burden of proof
Governing_Law: Refugee Convention, 'reasonable chance' standard for persecution
Application_Facts: Applicant claimed fear of military threats in Honduras
Defendant_Behavior: Board made unsupported assumptions and misinterpreted testimony
Grounds_for_Claim: Perceived military surveillance and threats in Honduras
Applicable_Legislation: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Refugee Convention
Procedural_Issue: Errors in evidence evaluation and potential confusion over burden of proof
Credibility_Assessment: Board undermined plausibility due to errors in interpretation
Evidence_Used: Testimony about military surveillance, family circumstances
Application_Basis: Fear of persecution based on perceived military targeting
Evidence_Assessed: Oral testimony, lack of corroboration on siblings
Governing_Rule: Burden of proof is 'reasonable chance', not beyond a reasonable doubt
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Board assumed facts not in evidence regarding applicant's siblings
Outcome: Decision overturned, case remitted for rehearing
Harm_Assessment: Risk of return to potential persecution in Honduras
Cause_Description: Applicant claimed refugee status based on perceived military threats in Honduras but was denied by the Board
Evidence_Handling: Improper reliance on unsupported assumptions and misinterpretation of testimony
Evidence_Issues: Misinterpretation of testimony, assumption of unproven facts
Residency_Compliance: Applicant lawfully present in Canada during claim process
Decision_Rationale: Errors in credibility assessment and burden of proof application
Evidentiary_Issues: Assumption of facts not in evidence, misinterpretation of testimony
